title: Lemon Dill Salmon with Garlic, White Wine, and Butter Sauce

instructions.1: Preheat oven to 375 degrees F (190 degrees C). Mix butter, white wine, lemon juice, and garlic together in a small bowl.
instructions.2: Pour a small amount of the butter mixture into an 8x8-inch baking pan until bottom is evenly coated; cover with a thin layer of dill. Place salmon, skin side down, into the baking pan. Sprinkle with remaining dill; pour remaining butter mixture over salmon. Cover tightly with aluminum foil.
instructions.3: Bake in preheated oven until fish flakes easily with a fork, 25 to 35 minutes. Sprinkle generously with almonds before serving.

questions.question: Is salmon from Step 2 still available in Step 3?
Is white wine live after Step 1?
What is the last time interval specified in Step 3?
Can we preheat (Step 1) and bake (Step 3) at the same time?
